fields.headline: In brief
fields.bodyText: Man dies after gang attacks Police were last night hunting a group of teenagers who left one man dead after a series of assaults on Saturday along the riverside in south London. David Morley, 37, died last night after he was attacked near Hungerford Bridge. Children die in house blaze A child, aged six, and another in her early teens died after a fire in a house in Weymouth, Dorset, yesterday. Three other children and two adults were taken to Dorset County hospital in Dorchester. Radio show hoaxer fined A man who rang a radio phone-in show to say he had driven off after deliberately knocking down and critically injuring a 16-year-old in Wolverhampton was fined £80 yesterday for wasting police time. Union warning on school trips The NASUWT warned yesterday that teachers should abandon school trips because of the danger of being sued if anything went wrong. A new test of the "educational validity" of trips should be introduced to reduce risks, the teaching union said. Last month, education watchdog Ofsted said too many schools did not take children on outdoor activities because they feared they would be sued if there was an accident. Dickens centre hit by hard times The Charles Dickens Centre, a museum in Rochester, Kent, dedicated to the author in a building he used in some of his novels, closed yesterday due to falling visitor numbers. Vulcan for sale on eBay A man has put his vintage Vulcan bomber up for sale on the internet auction site eBay. Brian Bateson bought the plane in 1983 and placed it at Blackpool airport for visitors to admire. Two share £4.5m jackpot Two people shared Saturday's £4.5m Lotto jackpot. The winning numbers were 3, 8, 9, 26, 27 and47. The bonus ball was 45. No one won the Lotto Extra jackpot. The numbers drawn were 21, 24, 25, 30, 31, and 41. Two people won the £250,000 Thunderball. The winning numbers were 1, 11, 16, 28, 29, with the Thunderball 5.
